column4: We visited Montreal, stayed downtown and visited several museums. We got a three day Museum/Transit pass which allowed us to visit up to 41 different museums and use the transit as many times as we wanted over the three days. It was very economical. The metro was conveniently located and fast. The Metro station was right across the street from...

As parking spaces are getting harder to fine and traffic in Mtl. is increasing the metro is a great way to travel. They have many different types of passes available check out their website stm.Great for children as an experince. If you have travelled to Paris ,London , Japan the metro lines are easy to figure out. Look for...

Easy to use, easy to grasp, maps everywhere and very helpful agents. We bought a 3-day pass for $18ca and rode everywhere. Clean and comfortable. Saw no agressive behavior only politeness and Public Art.

My only problem was actually finding the metro stations, which are rarely indicated by neighborhood signage and sometimes don't even have visible signs at the various entrances. Once found, the ticketing kiosks and navigation are fairly easy to comprehend and there are sometimes station agents that can help explain things.

If you take the metro you will be able to get around to most of Montreal. The service is generally good. The subway cars were generally clean, save for one that smelled like urine. Overall, a good experience.

Avoid all the crazy driving in the city and immerse yourself in the city and how it gets around. A great experience once you get the hang of it. Be sure to grab a map at the ticket wicket. No need for a schedule, the next one is only a few minutes away. Hang onto your kids if they are...

Our rental apartment was a 5 minute walk to the metro. We found it clean and easily navigable. We bought an unlimited pass for 3 days. It got us to whatever we wanted to visit in Montreal, it was usable even on the bus transport.

Inexpensive, clean, safe and can take you anywhere in Montreal. Ticket machines may make you crazy when you try to understand them at first but it is a good way to visit the city. I live on the outskirts of the city and I myself take the metro to go downtown because it is more efficient than the car. Don't...
Had to use the metro, found it reasonably easy as English speaking assistants are around to ask if a little confused.All okay ?
The Metro is a quick and efficient way to get around Montreal. Tourists can buy various cards that provide discounts.
there s no doubt thats faster than taking my car on rush hours ,u can reach the city in an hours from one side to another
easy to access and very convenient for travelling the city, trains come frequently and easy to understand maps and stations.
This is the most easiest way we found navigating through this beautiful city. The metro is fairly clean and the trains very much on time.

Simply said: clean, efficient and on time! The staff are very helpful and great ambassadors for Montreal. You can move around the city without hassle or delays, the cost is also reasonable...a day pass for only $10. Great job Montreal.

The Metro itself is very nice, and the rubber wheels still strike me, 50 years after I first used the Metro, as a great innovation. On the downside: the absence of escalators in many stations, and the absence of push buttons to open doors automatically are markers of a system that needs upgrading.

The first metro line was opened in 1967 for the World's fair, and there are now 4 lines which zig-zag Montreal. There is NO metro to the airport and that's too bad because bus 747 (cute ) gets stuck in Montreal traffic and it makes for a very long trip. Some of the stations are old looking, water leaks and...
there seems to be a Metro station within a few blocks of everything I wanted to do in Montreal. The lines are clearly marked and it is on different levels with color coding so easy to distinguish.

Although I walked to most of my attractions due to my hotel location, there were a few times that I had to depend on the Metro. Travel to Old Montreal, L'Oratorie Saint-Joseph du Mont-Royal and La Basilique Notre-Dame de Montreal are examples when this system was of great use.Ticket machines were readily available. On occasion when I had to...

It's been over 15 years since I rode the London, Paris, Brussels, Rome subway so I can't remember quite so well, but compared to the NYC subway the Montreal subway was a smooth delight. Easy to get around and moved fast! Plus, the stations are decorated with beautiful unique artwork.
Great system! Easy to use, and affordable....friendly staff that were able to speak in English well.Navigation was easy to figure out and the direction were clearly marked in French and English
Its the Metro and is the heart of montreal...that and bikes :P When it works, it's cheap, clean and fast...when it's down, its very very frustrating.

You can get around easily by subway in Montreal and it is safe at any time of the day. Taking the subway is an excellent way to people watch. From early Spring to late Fall, you can find public bikes at the exits of every station. Don't bother renting a car if you are staying downtown - parking can be...

Upside: range of fare options for your visit from single fare, day pass, and multi day passes. (3 bucks single fare).Clean stations, with some services ( food etc).However: LOTS OF STAIRS. MORE stairs. Have some stairs. The stations can be huge and confusing. Just follow the crowd. Upside, people are pretty helpful.From street level the stations aren't...
Easiest way to travel across the city, safe , relatively clean and fast . Some interesting artwork depending on the stations
We took the metro a few times. The stations are well distributed, the metro is clean and very often there are buses that can take you further.
The Montreal Metro is easy to use, and not crowded even at 8:30 -9 am in the morning, presumably in the middle of the rush hours. It is also a great way of getting around when it is freezing outside.

Tourists...don't waste your money using cabs as your primary way to go places. The metro is a cost effective way to get around Montreal. Buy a 3 day ticket for 18 CAD and use the metro as often as you like. You can also ride the buses with the same ticket for no extra charge.I have been to many...

The Metro is a great way to get around the city. They use a color coded system (easy to navigate). Take advantage of the All Day pass $10.00 or 3 day pass or there is an evening pass from 6pm-5am for $5.00. Go to any Information booth and get a map, determine where you would like to go & use...
Great way to explore Montreal !! Many stations convenient to star attractions! Always felt safe -- never had long waits!!

If you're a visitor to Montreal wanting to know more about our subway system (a.k.a Metro) here are some facts.Pros:- The trains come every 2 minutes on the busiest lines (green & orange) during rush hour.- The orange line is now slowly adding the new Azur state-of-the-art subway trains (to be completed by the end of 2018)....

Montreal is a city to walk. If it's not cold or rainy, I highly recommend walking around. Distances are generally not that long, and you'll find a lot of interesting things in the way!That being said, when it's not possible or the distances are too long, the metro is clean, punctual and offers a great service. The stations are...
the montrel metro can take you any place you want. you can get a map showing the places to see in montreal. it is safe, and do not miss the underground shopping.

Clean and very efficient. It is to me the best way to get around. ..and if you took the airport bus, your bus pass will be valid for the following 24 hrs. for unlimited rides on any of the metro and buses in the city.

We purchased a three-day pass which seemed the best deal for multiple use. Staff were friendly and quite helpful with directions. It's safe, clean and sometimes quite crowded.Lots of stairs and not many lifts which made it hard for me with a disability. there are four main lines with different colour codes. A good, fast, reliable way to get...

This is one of the cleanest, most efficient subway systems I've ever ridden. Navigating the various lines is very easy, and there was a train every few minutes. It's a cheap way to travel around the city.

Don't drive a car. It could be very stressful due to all road construction/renovation... The metro is easy, fast, clean & comfortable (specially the new train on orange line?). With a minimum of walk you can go to any major landmark. Buy pass that suits your need (evening, family, 3days...) and you can combine with buses.Welcome!
This is a great way to see Montreal. You can get a 3 day pass and go everywhere for 18 dollars. We found it very useful to get to places like the Olympic village.

Montreal Metro is a convenient way to transport yourself from anywhere in Montreal, nice and affordable. Very Secure and Police is always looking around so it make it even safer! sometimes the metro stops but nothing too long. Always on time!!! you can rely on it to get around Montreal

although I am an anglophone & the announcements are En Francais, I had no difficulties figuring out the well organized & color coded train lines. Compared to the sky train in Vancouver, this was much better organized, felt very safe, and was a great way to travel through the city.

Driving around Montreal has become a nightmare in recent years due to all the construction projects that are terrorizing neighbourhoods. Our nickname 'Coney Island' has no bearing to the famous NYC playground, but due to all the yellow construction cones that come out in May and stay until the snow comes in December. The Metro is now 50 years old,...

A great way to go around in a fast way without being affected by the weather. It's not too expensive, generally clean and safe. Often cool buskers playing music in the stations, now that's always fun. Just be ready for a lot of stairs, as escalators are not always present or do not always work and little stations have elevators....
The metro is very efficient and clean. We used it to get to many places and it is also reasonable in price.
Best way to visit Montreal nothing better then taking the Metro very easy to get around besides with all the traffic and construction stick to the Metro specially in Downtown Montreal ..

We have been staying in Montreal for the past 10 days, although this is not our first visit. We like the metro because it is clean and efficient. Although the network is limited it connects the inner part of Montreal. We are always impressed on how clean the trains and stations are. The system has obviously been based on the...

I have used all the major city subways in the United States (New York, Chicago, DC, Boston, etc..). I would have to rate this one higher than all of them. Clean, safe, efficient, fast, easy to find your bearings and locate the direction you need to go. If you are just staying a few days, you can get easily 1...
better for the tourists as most places we can also do/on foot. Also special rate different occassion

The Montreal Metro system was inaugurated 50 years ago, in October 1966. The original 26 Metro stations that made up the network all had architectural designs that were different from one to another. This unique characteristic has been retained to the current 68 stations: each is a unique architectural experience. Some, of course, are better than others, but some are...

Well this it´s and old metro system , and they take forever to update! still waiting for the new wagons. This is not a Handicap, wheelchair, people with groceries bags, travelers with luggage and not baby carts accesible stations, just a few station have elevators, also all stations don´t have full mechanical escalator system from street to the metro. Also...
If you plan on taking the subway with your stroller be prepared to carry it down and up lots of stairs as alot of subway stations don't have an elevator. Otherwise, cheap to travel around the city!
it is so old and dirty metro where all peoples eat and drink inside, if you dress well you must be careful to seat, i don't like it
not bad,really fast and nice and new clean wagons to travel.Sometimes too much people around rush hours
Much faster and easier to get around than via car and it will be even more important when even more construction is going to be happening!

The Montreal subway system covers a fair part of the island of Montreal . The main advantage is traveling during rush hour or getting around center downtown . Montreal traffic is becoming more and more of a nightmare . . . for many reasons . Driving center downtown , well I hope you have lots of time because traffic can...

I find the cars much smaller and shabbier than Toronto, but this subway system is very easy to navigate and is nicely spread out so you can get practically anywhere. Rush hour trains are massively packed but they get you there fast so it isnt a big deal.

Took the metro from a station near our hotel to the Olympic Park. 2 girls kindly gave us their free pass they had had for competing in the marathon. It was so easy to use the metro. Clean and efficient
Montreal Metro is not a touristic attraction per se but it's a very easy way to get around the city, mainly during winter or rainy days! It's quite cheap!

We got a 3 day pass & it was the best thing we did, very efficient & timely. Took us everywhere we wanted to go & allowed us to walk/explore places we otherwise wouldn't have$18 for a 3 day pass .. Well worth it !

Took the metro to go to the montreal children's hospital and found the trip to be pleasant. Apart from all the renovations the cars and the area inside were clean. The ticket agent was very helpful at CADILLAC STATION and nice. Found to be less beggars and street performers than 25 years ago. Found the stepped up security a welcome...

Taxi costs add up very quickly if you're trying to get around to do things. We would buy a 1 day pass and lasts 24hrs, unlimited usage. What a great way to get to places!! And it's so quick!! Loved it!!

The Metro is Montreal's subway system. It consists of four colored lines. It's easy to use. Also the person working in the ticket booth, can help you with directions to get to your destination. It's a good idea to ask for the metro map at the ticket booth. The metro is clean and is a very convenient way to travel.
Very impressed by the metro. Efficient ,clean and safe.We used when we visited Montreal.It is well posted to make use easy.

While most of its instructions are in French, the Metro is easy to navigate and gets you nearly everywhere you want to go in Montreal. Line switches are very easy, too, and you can even take it to the train station. If you get the 3 day pass, you can use the bus service, which runs to the airport.

the Montreal metro has only four lines clearly marked by color; easily swiped tickets; safe and clean (compared to NYC); quick way to get around Montreal! the wall maps even show which metro goes to main attractions. It's not cheap: $3.25 a trip but the $10 all day pass is a deal! totally best way to see the city.
One of the best and cheapest ways to get around. Clean, rapid and no 2 stations alike. Bring your camera.

Montreal's Metro shows definite signs of futuristic vision from the era that built it. Many of the stations feature multi-story open space over the main platform station area. The trains themselves run on rubber tires over concrete "rails" producing a nice ride. The trains are a bit hot in the summer. But you get some good breezes through the roof...

Really a disappointing system for a city that would like to be world class. The three day opus card was a winner, as is the touch to pay system (a la London). But that is it for the good. The stations are too far a walk from anything, and access across the city is limited. We stayed in the Mont...

Used it with friends recently (Aug. 8 'til 15). It was easy to use. Fast considering all the renovation downtown Montreal.Maps of th esubway 'metro' are shown everywhere. I recommend users to gather their 'stuff' and throw it in the garbage instead of droping on the floor. One person just threw her sandwich on the floor at 10:30 a.m.....
Buy an extended pass, ask for a metro map, a map of Montreal and enjoy the ride. We toured the entire city in 1 wee using the Metro. Clean, fast, safe and economical.

We used the Montreal Metro recently to get from our hotel to Parc Jean Drapeau for a music festival. The Metro system generally appears to be extensive and the maps are easy to read. The stations are well-marked with signage. The train service was regular and punctual. The price was inexpensive ($17 (CAD) for a 3-day music festival pass, purchased...

I enjoyed taking the metro. However, it was difficult sometimes to find where the entrance to the Metro was as its signage is not very well post outside or I couldn't find it. And when I was inside there are so many doors that you don't know where to go. Directional signage needs improvement.Also be aware that the entrance...

This was my first time in a metro station I had no idea what to expect except for movies haha but it was amazing and really really easy to navigate! Not to mention it had many liqour stores and fast food places inside of the stops! I wish they had one in my town now
Mtl metro is even worse than Bruxelles. No mean feat. Essentially none of the stations offer elevator service for impaired mobility folks. Signage is a total joke. So embarrassed to be a Canadian.

I've used subways in a number of cities and even different countries, but this system had one of the most spacious underground areas of all of them. I only used the system once for a return trip and back but the trains were on time and I never had too long of a wait. My only complaint would be having...

We wanted to visit Parc Mont Royal. The staff at our hotel explained that it would be easiest to get there by taking the metro from Place D'Armes. The lady selling tickets there (May 23rd) thoroughly and patiently explained the best way for us to travel ($6 for 1 round trip each) which included a transfer to the #11 bus...
The pass is good for all public transportation. The city is walkable but you will need the metro to visit the Olympic City, the Jean Talon market and the Saint Joseph Oratory, all worth a visit.

The Opus card for the week is economical and very useful for seeing the sites in Montreal. Still do some walking but fast and clean and no one to tip although occasionally panhandler will hang out at the stations. They all seem easygoing and are usually straightforward asking for change.

We rode 3 times over last weekend and had no problems. It was very clean, safe and we'll organized. We ride the Metro alot in Europe and you don't always find that.At 3.25 a single ride though it's very expensive. We visited Barcelona for 16 days at Christmas this past year and it was only 80 cents euro. I...
This is one of the best transit system I have ever been on. I have never been to Montreal and the transit was so easy to take it was a breeze!

Bought a three day pass at the airport the time starts from the first swipe. Ends at midnight. The pass is good for bus and metro. You can take the 747 bus from the airport to downtown. It makes 8-9 stops Other than the 747 I used the metro mostly and walked.

The trains run on tires. So are they trains?!?! Who cares! I found the Metro system very novel, it seems to run well and I didn't feel like we waited a great amount of time at any point for a train.There was one incident where people got off and the train waited 15 seconds for people to get on...

Clean. Efficient. Friendly helpful staff! Really an easy way to traverse the city with spacious platforms and great coaches. Made for a pleasant way to get around. By a round trip ticket while purchasing to save both time and money later!

Although the facilities look a bit old, and some places were dirty and broken, the trains run on time all the time. Like every 6 minutes! Cheap to use, unlimited pass cost $18 for three days. Also works for buses which are also useful, but a little less frequent. Easy to navigate, although a lot of French:). Oui oui!!
Comfortable way of getting round the city and better managed with regard people movement.Downside is the lack of disabled access which thankfully is being addressed.

Trying out the Metro was one of my "must do, must see" items on my visit to Montreal. I knew the trains ran on rubber tyres like some Paris lines, but hadn't quite realised this was the only complete tyred system anywhere. It's an unbelievably smooth ride and the acceleration and braking impressive. The system is does not appear not...

Dont be scared of people that look a bit scary, they wont do anything. Tip: do not go in the first and the last cart of the metro, people who on drugs and have been drinking like to go in those b/c they have singled out people too mess with. Their is not a lot of people who go in...

I come from a city that has exactly one metro line, and it goes in a straight line, and it has less than ten stops. As such, I'm always a little daunted when I go somewhere where the best way to get around is the metro. I apparently didn't need to be worried about Montreal.The metro is very affordable...

We took the metro from our hotel to the Olympic site. The Kiosk was easy to use, the metro platform was clean, and the ride to and from the site was in a comfortable car. The metro was a very good way to travel around the city. The metro covers most of the areas that tourist and travelers would want...

During a recent trip to Montreal, my wife and I bought a day pass on the Metro. Being from Boston and using the T there, I'm used to an old subway system that seems to take forever to get places. Not Montreal's Metro! It was fast, averaged only about ten seconds at each stop, and really gained speed between stops....

No smell of Urine, no Cigarettes, well-heated, nicely tiled, lately in full reno Mode..lacks Elevators (actually Barcelona Metro should be the Model to emulate..)..here they will bring the mother with a baby carriage to the frickn Cashier instead of a level lower to the Rail Platform..what were you thinking..lol?Musicians must have a licence to play their flute or strut their...

This was my toddlers favorite thing in the city. Seriously, she threw a fit every time we were leaving the train platform because she wanted to rider again. Other then that, the system was great. We bought the weekend ticket that is good for unlimited rides from Friday night until early Monday morning and it was a great value at...

I was in Montreal for a week. Staying at the Montreal Marriott Château Champion and asked the Conceirge how the best way to get around was. She said the Metro. Showed me where to go and have me directions. I was a little nervous I might get lost. Went on my way got on and it was easy to get...

Super easy way to travel in Montreal! We took the metro to the big O to see the Toronto Blue Jays play the Red Sox. It was by far the best way to get there because traffic above ground in Montreal is not the best (especially with construction). Great informative staff too!

Clean, easy to read and understand maps. We parked at the Biodome and rode into the heart of the city, Place des arts. A great intro the the underground transit system for a couple of Vermont kiddos. There are machines in the stations to buy tickets. Only cash is accepted at the window and if using your credit card in...

What a great system. Easy to buy a pass, cheap, simple to navigate, gives access to the whole city and has stops within walking distance to any desirable spot. We used an OPUS card for the bus from the airport and for the next three days on the underground. Never a long wait for a train, even on a Sunday,...

When you consider the cost of parking and driving in Montreal, you are glad that their subway system (Metro) is there to make it so easy. The trains run on a timely basis and both the trains and stations are clean.
Such a wonderful and cheap way of knowing Montreal. When we went there, was completely full of snow and drive was very difficult, so we decided to use only metro and I really recommend.
